column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/b641c9cd217f7789726bb25ab87cd35e2e5fcaad for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
Won't this also bypass the outbound connections limit?\n

@laanwj yes, but it did also before. This is at least good for testing. Does this cause any problems?

OpenNetworkConnection calls ConnecNode. So, as I said, the only difference is that the connection has fNetworkNode set to true now.
Sure, it's fine with me if that was the behaviour before as well.\n
